title: ACCC refund policy RE Draven Bobble head

embed.description: You have the right to ask for a repair, replacement or refund under the Australian Consumer Law consumer guarantees for products and services bought on or after 1 January 2011. If you have a minor problem with a product or service, the business can choose to give you a free repair instead of a replacement or refund.

body: This actually goes against the ACCC rights. I would like to know when the skins i paid for will be restored to the way they were prior to April 1 2016. This addition you have chosen to add without my consent has clearly violated my rights as a consumer. If there was an option to remove the addition at my own free will, i would not have an issue. i bought skins from you and they are not working as advertised. I'm extremely unhappy as they are all affecting the way the product i bought and not working they way that your company advertised them.

replies.body:
Sorry, but Riot's refund policy covers this. This is a silly argument since it's just temporary, but even so, Riot can change anything you paid RP for and you aren't entitled to a refund if you don't like the change.

The Draven bobble heads are only from the 1st to the 3rd anyway.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751864-Content-Refund-FAQ#h5
